TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebDescriptionAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Defines the string value to use as a ToolTip for a property of a Web Parts control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control provides a generic user interface (UI) that enables users to edit custom properties on <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> and server controls placed in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> zones. The editing UI is provided for properties that are marked in the source code with the `WebBrowsable` attribute (from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute> class). When a property is marked with this attribute, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control creates the editing UI based on the type of the property, and uses a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> object if needed to convert the value in each editing control to the type of the property.
The `WebDescription` attribute (from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute> class) allows you to specify the ToolTip that appears with each control in the editing UI when the mouse pointer is positioned over the control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute> attribute to assign a ToolTip to a property on a Web Parts control. The custom `UserJobType` property is given the ToolTip "Select the category that corresponds to your job." to display in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control. This example is part of a larger example found in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> class overview.
[!code-csharp[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview/CS/userinfowebpart.cs#6)] [!code-vb[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview/VB/userinfowebpart.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute.Description%2A> property to an empty string ("").

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string description) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The ToolTip to use in a .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified description.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute.Description%2A> property to `description`. The `description` parameter is the value that will appear as a ToolTip for a property in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute> attribute to assign a ToolTip to a property on a Web Parts control. The custom `UserJobType` property is given the ToolTip "Select the category that corresponds to your job." to display in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control. The ToolTip is assigned through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor. This example is part of a larger example found in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> class overview.
[!code-csharp[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview/CS/userinfowebpart.cs#6)] [!code-vb[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview/VB/userinfowebpart.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute.DescriptionValue%2A> property gets or sets the same value that is accessed through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute.Description%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDescriptionAttribute.DescriptionValue%2A> property is protected and therefore only accessible either within the class or through a derived class.
